Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.notebook

Class Notebook

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.notebook.Notebook
public class Notebook extends Object
A class to store all task lists and perform operations on them. Serves as the point of contact with the GUI and is therefore able to perform any legal operation on the task lists and notebook itself.
Author:
Jaden Levy, Chirag Sreedhara

  • Constructor Details

    • Notebook

      public Notebook(String notebookName)
      Constructs a notebook object and assigns values to all fields.
      Parameters:
      notebookName - name for notebook
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the notebookName is null, empty, or matches ACTIVE_TASKS_NAME.

  • Method Details

    • saveNotebook

      public void saveNotebook(File file)
      Saves current notebook to given file
      Parameters:
      file - file to save to

    • getNotebookName

      public String getNotebookName()
      Gets the name of the notebook.
      Returns:
      notebook name

    • isChanged

      public boolean isChanged()
      Gets whether the Notebook was edited before the last save.
      Returns:
      value of isChanged field

    • setChanged

      public void setChanged(boolean changed)
      Sets whether the Notebook has been changed.
      Parameters:
      changed - value to set isChanged field to

    • addTaskList

      public void addTaskList(edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.tasks.TaskList taskList)
      Adds a given task list to the list of taskLists.
      Parameters:
      taskList - list to add to list of task lists
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the new TaskList’s name is ACTIVE_TASKS_NAME or a duplicate of an existing TaskList (both case insensitive)

    • getTaskListsNames

      public String[] getTaskListsNames()
      Returns an array of the task list names (Active is always first)
      Returns:
      String array of all task list names

    • setCurrentTaskList

      public void setCurrentTaskList(String taskListName)
      Sets the currentTaskList to the AbstractTaskList with the given name. If a TaskList with that name is not found, then the currentTaskList is set to the activeTaskList.
      Parameters:
      taskListName - The name to set to the task list

    • getCurrentTaskList

      public edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.tasks.AbstractTaskList getCurrentTaskList()
      Returns the current TaskList being worked upon.
      Returns:
      currentTaskList field

    • editTaskList

      public void editTaskList(String taskListName)
      Allows functionality to rename a task list.
      Parameters:
      taskListName - Name of task list to edit
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the currentTaskList is an ActiveTaskList, if the new name matches “Active Tasks” or is a duplicate of the name of another TaskList (case insensitive)

    • removeTaskList

      public void removeTaskList()
      Current Task List is removed and updated with the activeTaskList.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the currentTaskList is an ActiveTaskList with the message “The Active Tasks list may not be deleted."

    • addTask

      public void addTask(edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.tasks.Task t)
      Task is added to a the currentTaskList if it is not the active task list. getActiveTaskList() helper method aids in the adding to the ActiveTaskList.
      Parameters:
      t - Task to add to task list

    • editTask

      public void editTask(int idx, String taskName, String taskDescription, boolean recurring, boolean active)
      Edits a task at the given index. getActiveTaskList() helper method is used to update the ActiveTaskList.
      Parameters:
      idx - index of task to update
      taskName - Name of task updated
      taskDescription - Description of task updated
      recurring - value of recurring boolean for task updated
      active - value of active boolean for task updated
